description: As a full-time developer for Accutech Systems Corporation, I am a member of the team working on the Cheetah Wealth Management project. I am helping to build new features, fix existing bugs,  and refactor code while operating under a Scrum framework. Technologies being used include C#, ASP.NET Core, JavaScript, Vue.js, and Entity Framework.

During the fall 2021 semester, I was a member of a research team working on a project in collaboration with the CERIAS center at Purdue. The project was intitiated with the purpose of strengthening cybersecurity practices in industrial environments. I helped to set up the initial infrastructure, which included installing the HUBzero CMS on a CentOS server and implementing a data visualization workflow for manufactured parts.

This was my internship for summer 2021 before I attended graduate school for one semester. Over the course of the internship, I helped to transition company's CheetahGO project (my undergraduate capstone project) from a Xamarin-based Android/iOS application to progressive web application based on Vue.js and an ASP.NET Core Web API, which obtains client data from the main Cheetah database. I also learned the basics of Scrum and met with the manager of software development at least once a week to give updates on my progress.

As an undergraduate teaching assistant I helped the class instructor to teach the material to the students, assisted students who found themselves struggling, and held several office hour sessions throughout the school week. These classes taught a variety of topics, including discrete mathematics, Python programming, Java programming, and the basics of computer networking.
